alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 04 at 11:34AM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A Gale-force low is moving into the Gulf of Alaska Monday. The associated front will track northward, bringing the Panhandle preciptiation. The northerly winds in Northern Lynn Canal are keeping the cooler air in place, so the precip is falling as snow. Moderate to heavy snow will result over the 24-hour period. Areas closer to sea level will receive snowfall amounts around 5 to 9 inches over the 24-hour period. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Klondike Highway, Haines Highway, and Klukwan. * WHEN...From noon Monday to noon AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow has been reported this morning. For Haines and the Haines Highway, heavy snow is expected Monday afternoon with snowfall rates near 1 to 2 inches per hour. Snowfall rates will diminish Monday evening before heavier snow moves back in Monday night into Tuesday morning. For the Klondike Highway, moderate snowfall is expected Monday afternoon with heavy snow moving in late Monday night into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. Heavy wet snow will be difficult to manage due to high water content. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
